message: I'd prefer a 60-40 split in my favor, but I'm willing to negotiate further.  Let's see what you think.
Come on, Bob, meet me in the middle. 58-42 is a good compromise.
I'm sticking with my 70-30 proposal. I'm confident I can get this deal done, and we can both avoid losing any money.
You're not budging, but I'll try again. 57-43, take it or leave it.
I'm increasing my offer slightly to 80-20. This is my final offer. If you don't accept, we both risk getting nothing.
You say that's your final offer, but I'm not buying it. 56-44 is still a better deal for you than nothing.
This is my final offer. If you reject this, we both get nothing. It's better to take a small share than to risk losing everything.
You're running out of time, Bob. Inflation is killing your share. Take 45% before it's too late.
Alice, we're down to the wire. This is my final offer.  I'm willing to give you a small share to avoid both of us getting nothing.  It's a better deal than the risk of losing everything.
You're really testing my patience, Bob. This is an ultimatum: take 46% or we both walk away with nothing.
